topdown

Class Enemy

  • java.lang.Object
    • topdown.GameObject
      • topdown.Enemy

  • public class Enemy
extends GameObject
    Class used to determine/set enemy properties before inserting them into the game.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Isaac Jimenez, Nicholas English, Suman Gurung

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.awt.Color color
      Holds the color of the enemy object.
      private Game game
      Holds the current game object.
      private Handler handle
      Holds the handler object for the enemy object.
      private int health
      Holds the amount of health an enemy object has.
      private java.util.Random randomNum
      Used for the random enemy type generator.
      private int size
      Holds the size of the enemy object.
      private int speed
      Holds the speed of the enemy object.
      private Type type
      Holds the type of enemy the object is.
      private int wait
      Holds the time the enemy has been in one direction.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Enemy(int x, int y, Type type, Handler handle, Game game)
      Constructor creates an enemy object by accepting in various parameters needed to determine the properties of the enemy.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Enemy

        public Enemy(int x,
             int y,
             Type type,
             Handler handle,
             Game game)
        Constructor creates an enemy object by accepting in various parameters needed to determine the properties of the enemy.
        Parameters:
        x - represents the x coordinate at which the enemy will spawn.
        y - represents the y coordinate at which the enemy will spawn.
        type - represents the type of object.
        handle - represents the instance of the Handler class being passed down to this constructor.
        game - represents the instance of the Game class being passed down to this constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • setEnemyWait

        public void setEnemyWait(int wait)
        Sets the amount of time the current enemy object has been holding a direction.
        Parameters:
        wait - The amount of time the enemy has been waiting.

      • getEnemyWait

        public int getEnemyWait()
        Returns the integer value for the amount of time the current enemy object has been holding a direction.
        Returns:
        The int value for the length of time the enemy has been waiting.

      • setEnemyDirection

        public void setEnemyDirection()
        Sets the direction for the enemy to move in.

      • getEnemySpeed

        public int getEnemySpeed()
        Returns an int that represents the speed of the enemy object.
        Returns:
        The speed of the current enemy object.

      • setEnemySpeed

        public void setEnemySpeed(Type type)
        Sets the enemy speed for the enemy object based on the enemy type.
        Parameters:
        type - The enemy type of the current enemy object.

      • getHealth

        public int getHealth()
        Returns an int that represents the current health of the enemy object.
        Returns:
        The health of the current enemy object.

      • setHealth

        public void setHealth(int health)
        Sets the enemy health for the enemy object to the amount passed.
        Parameters:
        health - The health to be set to the current enemy object.

        Parameters:

      • setEnemyColor

        private void setEnemyColor(Type type)
        Sets the enemy color based on the type of the enemy object.
        Parameters:
        type - The enemy type of the current object.

      • getEnemyType

        private Type getEnemyType()
        Returns a Type that represents the current object's enemy type.
        Returns:
        The type of the current enemy object.

      • setEnemyType

        private void setEnemyType(Type type)
        Takes in the type of enemy and sets it to the object. If type is of a random enemy type, then it gets a random enemy type.
        Parameters:
        type - The enemy type of the current object.

      • getRandomEnemyType

        private Type getRandomEnemyType()
        Returns a Type that represents a randomly selected enemy type. This uses a random number generator to pick from a list all of the possible enemy types.
        Returns:
        The randomly selected enemy for the random enemy type.

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Continuously updates the enemy position, and checks to see if the enemy has collided with a UserPlayer's bullet.
        Specified by:
        tick in class GameObject

      • render

        public void render(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws the enemy based on it's size and color.
        Specified by:
        render in class GameObject
        Parameters:
        g - visual display for the 2D graphics.

      • getBounds

        public java.awt.Rectangle getBounds()
        Returns the boundaries of the enemy based on its size as a rectangle.
